text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to maintain good credit?
text.Response A:
Review your credit score.
Know what your credit score means.
Improve the credit score factors that you can.
Know when to ask for help.
Don’t use all your credit.
Take out credit slowly.
Diversify your debt.
Keep using the same accounts.
Don’t obsess over your credit score.
text.Response B: Sure, I’d be happy to.  First, let me explain a little about what credit is, and what it’s used for.  When you buy something on credit, you’re borrowing money from a bank or other lender, and agreeing to pay it back later.  So, when you borrow money, you’re building up a credit history, which is a record of how you’ve borrowed money in the past, and how you’ve paid it back.  Credit history is important because it gives a sense of how responsible you are with money, and how likely you are to pay back any money you borrow in the future.  When you have a good credit history, you’re a good credit risk, and banks and other lenders will be more likely to lend you money in the future.

558.displayed_text:
Prompt

Can you tell me how to maintain good credit?

Response A

Review your credit score.
Know what your credit score means.
Improve the credit score factors that you can.
Know when to ask for help.
Don’t use all your credit.
Take out credit slowly.
Diversify your debt.
Keep using the same accounts.
Don’t obsess over your credit score.

Response B

Sure, I’d be happy to. First, let me explain a little about what credit is, and what it’s used for. When you buy something on credit, you’re borrowing money from a bank or other lender, and agreeing to pay it back later. So, when you borrow money, you’re building up a credit history, which is a record of how you’ve borrowed money in the past, and how you’ve paid it back. Credit history is important because it gives a sense of how responsible you are with money, and how likely you are to pay back any money you borrow in the future. When you have a good credit history, you’re a good credit risk, and banks and other lenders will be more likely to lend you money in the future.
